title: Sean Dyche sacked by Nottingham Forest with club in relegation fight
description: Nottingham Forest sack Sean Dyche as head coach after just 114 days in charge and are looking for their fourth boss of the season.
content:
Nottingham Forest have sacked Sean Dyche as head coach after just 114 days in charge and are looking for their fourth boss of the season.
Forest were held to a goalless draw at home by bottom club Wolves on Wednesday and are just three points above t... [6728 chars]

title: Celtic: 'Big asset' Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain has immediate impact with 'class goal'
description: Martin O'Neill hails Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's impact after the former Arsenal and Liverpool midfielder nets a crucial winner on his Celtic debut.
content:
Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain only had 14 touches after being introduced for his Celtic debut as a 78th-minute substitute against Livingston on Wednesday.
However, one of them could have a telling influence on the Scottish Premiership title race.

title: US House votes to overturn Trump's tariffs on Canada
description: Six Republican lawmakers joined Democrats to back a resolution that seeks to end the tariffs Trump imposed on Canada last year.
content:
The US House of Representatives has voted to rescind US President Donald Trump's tariffs on Canadian goods.
In a 219 to 211 vote, six Republican lawmakers joined Democrats to back a resolution that seeks to end the tariffs Trump imposed on Canada las... [2379 chars]

title: Scrap proposals for England holiday tax, hospitality bosses urge
description: Critics say the proposed tax could force families to shorten trips or spend their money overseas.
content:
Plans for a tax on people taking holidays in England should be scrapped, 200 hospitality and leisure bosses have urged.
The government is considering allowing mayors and other local leaders in England to introduce a "modest" tourist tax, or visitor l... [3638 chars]

title: Parents of children taken in to care should get more help, say experts after Victoria Marten death
description: Review says trauma-informed support could help interrupt ‘destructive cycles’ and reduce risk of harm to future babies
content:
Parents whose children are taken into care should receive trauma-informed support to reduce the risk of harm to any further babies they have, according to child protection experts.
